# Source: https://biomejs.dev/guides/manual-installation/

# Manual installation 

Using Biome's standalone CLI binary can be a great choice if you aren't already using Node.js or `npm` (or any other package manager). Or in other words, Biome shouldn't be the only reason for you to have a `package.json`.

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)Note

If you're already using `npm` or another package manager, then using the package manager is the [preferred way to install](/guides/getting-started#installation) Biome. You're already familiar with the tooling, and installing and updating are simpler.

## Supported platforms

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "Supported platforms"]](#supported-platforms)

You have to pick the correct binary for your platform for Biome work. The following table should help you do so.

  CPU Architecture      Windows                     macOS                                      Linux                       Linux (musl)
  --------------------- --------------------------- ------------------------------------------ --------------------------- --------------------------------
  `arm64`   `win32-arm64`   `darwin-arm64` (M1 or newer)   `linux-arm64`   `linux-arm64-musl`
  `x64`     `win32-x64`     `darwin-x64`                   `linux-x64`     `linux-x64-musl`

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)Note

Use the Linux variant for Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

## Homebrew

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "Homebrew"]](#homebrew)

Biome is available as a [Homebrew formula](https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/biome) for macOS and Linux users.

<figure class="frame is-terminal not-content">
<pre data-language="shell"><code>1brew install biome</code></pre>
<div class="copy">
<div>

</div>
</div>
<figcaption><span class="title"></span><span class="sr-only">Terminal window</span></figcaption>
</figure>

## Docker

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "Docker"]](#docker)

Biome publishes [official Docker images](https://github.com/biomejs/docker/pkgs/container/biome) that support the **amd64** and **arm64** architectures for all Biome versions starting from `v1.7.0`.

<figure class="frame not-content">
<pre data-language="plaintext"><code>1ghcr.io/biomejs/biome:2ghcr.io/biomejs/biome:.3ghcr.io/biomejs/biome:..</code></pre>
<div class="copy">
<div>

</div>
</div>
</figure>

Here are a couple examples on how to use the Docker image:

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)Note

The default workdir is `/code` in the Docker image.

<figure class="frame is-terminal not-content">
<pre data-language="shell"><code>1# Lint files2docker run -v $(pwd):/code ghcr.io/biomejs/biome lint3docker run -v $(pwd):/code ghcr.io/biomejs/biome lint --write4
5# Format files6docker run -v $(pwd):/code ghcr.io/biomejs/biome format7docker run -v $(pwd):/code ghcr.io/biomejs/biome format --write</code></pre>
<div class="copy">
<div>

</div>
</div>
<figcaption><span class="title"></span><span class="sr-only">Terminal window</span></figcaption>
</figure>

## Using a published binary

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "Using a published binary"]](#using-a-published-binary)

To install Biome, grab the executable for your platform from the [latest CLI release](https://github.com/biomejs/biome/releases) on GitHub and give it execution permission.

<figure class="frame is-terminal not-content">
<pre data-language="shell"><code>1# macOS arm (M1 or newer)2curl -L https://github.com/biomejs/biome/releases/download/@biomejs/biome@2.3.10/biome-darwin-arm64 -o biome3chmod +x biome4
5# Linux (x86_64)6curl -L https://github.com/biomejs/biome/releases/download/@biomejs/biome@2.3.10/biome-linux-x64 -o biome7chmod +x biome8
9# Windows (x86_64, Powershell)10Invoke-WebRequest -Uri &quot;https://github.com/biomejs/biome/releases/download/@biomejs/biome@2.3.10/biome-win32-x64.exe&quot; -OutFile &quot;biome.exe&quot;</code></pre>
<div class="copy">
<div>

</div>
</div>
<figcaption><span class="title"></span><span class="sr-only">Terminal window</span></figcaption>
</figure>

Now you can use Biome by simply running `./biome`.

## Next Steps

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "Next Steps"]](#next-steps)

Follow our [Getting Started guide](/guides/getting-started/).
